content.description: No sit start here. Start by standing on a slopey ledge. Reach for some small pockets, then once again... stand up on the next slopey ledge! Reach for the hairy hole, shuffle your feet and top out!
content.protection: Bring a couple pads and a good spotter. Watch your feet if you bail!
content.location: Left of Hooker Boots and Deception.

content.description: Start with a lay back on a good ear rail. Move up the arÃªte on slopers. Top out, don't flop out. Also a sit start variation with two small crimps. Adds a grade at least.
content.protection: 2 pads and one real cool dude.
content.location: Same boulder as Slope N Slide and Hooker Boots.

content.description:
Really cool route with fun moves.

Start on a slopey block. Traverse left on some slopers. Once you hit the jug move straight up the face on some slopers. Don't slide off the top out!
content.location: Take a short trail left before you reach Big Sky Grit.

content.description: Little foot starts on a great rail. Here comes the crux... Great right hand crimp and slopey feet, reach out left for a sloper with a small crimp. Re-establish another smear for a foot and reach up for a side pull jug. After you pull through, you're home free!
content.location: Far left from Slopin on the River.

content.description: Fun body positioning starts you off for this route. Crux is the first hold off of the start. Small crimpy ledge. Once you make the big step your off for the races. Enjoy!
content.protection: 1 maybe 2 pads. Don't miss this one!
content.location: Around the corner from Slopin on the River. Climb that slabby face.

content.description: Once again, another slopey stand start. Great rail for your hands.. Establish those feet and reach for what looks like some good holds... Deception! The holds are very slopey. Hold on and step high to reach the top out.
content.protection: 1-2 pads again. Maybe a lil guy for the ledge underneath.
content.location: Smack dab in between Va-JJ and Hooker Boots.
